snippet: The growing political heft of the Taishang, the name given to Taiwanese in China who have staked their livelihoods on its economy, has become a point of contention in a presidential race that has raised questions about embracing Beijing.
abstract: Estimated 200,000 Taiwanese people in Beijing are returning home for a presidential election whose outcome could determine the future relationship between China and Taiwan, which has warmed since Taiwan's Pres Ma Ying-jeou took office; Ma faces challenger Tsai Ing-wen, whose party has long advocated formal independence, a position known to infuriate Beijing.
lead_paragraph: The growing political heft of the Taishang, the name given to Taiwanese in China who have staked their livelihoods on its economy, has become a point of contention in a presidential race that has raised questions about embracing Beijing.

headline.main: Taiwan Vote Lures Back Expatriates in China
headline.print_headline: Taiwan Vote Lures Back Expatriates In China
